title: Britain to operate 70 flights to bring back people after Thomas Cook collapse
text:
Britain to operate 70 flights to bring back people after Thomas Cook collapse

Stock Markets 58 minutes ago (Sep 25, 2019 02:01AM ET)

(Reuters) - More than 70 flights were scheduled to operate on Wednesday, Britain's Civil Aviation Authority said, to bring back 16,500 people after the collapse of travel firm Thomas Cook. The company, which ran hotels, resorts and airlines for 19 million people a year, had about 600,000 people abroad when it collapsed in the early hours of Monday. The aviation regulator launched the largest peacetime repatriation on Monday to bring people back to Britain.
